title: Manage and Monitor Autonomous Database
description: The labs in this workshop show you a variety of ways to manage and monitor your Oracle Autonomous Database on Shared Infrastructure (ADB-S). You will provision a new ADB instance, practice connecting to the database securely with and without a connection wallet, examine a variety of ways to monitor database performance and other metrics, apply scaling and auto scaling, enable disaster recovery using Autonomous Data Guard, create refreshable database clones, set event and alarm notifications, and secure your data using Oracle Data Safe.

title: Low Code Development Oracle APEX on Autonomous Database
description: Using APEX, developers can quickly develop and deploy compelling apps that solve real problems and provide immediate value. You won't need to be an expert in a vast array of technologies to deliver sophisticated solutions. Focus on solving the problem and let APEX take care of the rest.

title: Machine Learning on Autonomous Database
description: Oracle integrates machine learning across the Oracle stack and the enterprise, fully leveraging Oracle Database and Oracle Autonomous Database.  In this workshop, create a machine learning model and move the model to ADB.  Explore machine learning notebooks and use prediction in applications.

title: Boost Analytics Performance with Oracle Database In-Memory
description: Oracle Database In-Memory provides a unique dual-format architecture that enables tables to be simultaneously represented in memory using traditional row format and a new in-memory column format. This series of labs uses Oracle Database 21c to demonstrate how Database In-Memory is orders of magnitude faster than the traditional row store. Labs will show how to get started with Database In-Memory, how to populate and administer the IM column store, and how to run queries including joins and aggregations. It also highlights new features available in Oracle Database 21c that improve the performance of JSON applications and allow the contents of the IM column store to be automatically managed.

title: Oracle WebLogic Server Kubernetes Operator Tutorial
description: This workshop provides the process of moving an existing WebLogic Server application into a Kubernetes cluster on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure in the Oracle Public Cloud.

title: Database 19c - Hybrid Partitioning
description: The Hybrid Partition Tables feature extends Oracle Partitioning by enabling partitions to reside in both Oracle Database segments and in external files and sources. This feature significantly enhances the functionality of partitioning for Big Data SQL where large portions of a table can reside in external partitions.  Use hybrid partitioned tables in an Oracle 19c database to move non-active partitions to external files.

title: Enterprise Manager Fundamentals
description: Learn how to use Oracle Enterprise Manager to perform common use cases for Oracle Database Lifecycle Management (including configuration and compliance, provisioning, patching, and upgrades) and Oracle Database Performance Management (including overall database performance, SQL analysis, real-time operation monitoring, and tuning).- Easy and quick to deploy - everything starts automatically in under 20 minutes

title: Oracle's Cloud Data Platform: Autonomous-Driven & AI-Infused
description: This workshop will walk you through the process of using the Autonomous Data Warehouse for storing analytical datasets and applying Machine Learning models in order to learn the correlation between different attributes and predict the future demand while leveraging Application Express to create a simple application as well as link to a 3rd party web app.

title: Back up and recover Oracle database to OCI
description: One of the fundamental best practices for Database disaster recovery is creating current, secured backups. Learn how to create a back-up strategy for your on-premises Database using Oracle Cloud.

title: Load and Analyze Your Data with Autonomous Database
description: In this workshop, you will go through the steps to get started using the Oracle Autonomous Database on Shared Infrastructure (ADB-S). You will provision a new ADB instance, load data from a variety of sources, troubleshoot data loads, and visualize your data using Oracle Analytics Cloud.

title: Goldengate 19c Microservices
description: Oracle GoldenGate offers a high-performance, fault-tolerant, easy-to-use, and flexible real-time data streaming platform for big data environments. It easily extends customers’ real-time data integration architectures to big data systems without impacting the performance of the source systems and enables timely business insight for better decision making. This workshop focuses on GoldenGate Real-Time Data Capture demonstrating four scenarios that you can use (both on-premise and in the cloud) to capture real-time data changes from your sources.

title: Introduction to Machine Learning Algorithms on ADB
description: In this workshop you will explore the Oracle Machine Learning (OML) SQL notebook application provided with your Autonomous Data Warehouse. This browser-based application provides a web interface to run SQL queries and scripts, which can be grouped together within a notebook. Notebooks can be used to build single reports, collections of reports, and even dashboards. OML provides a simple way to share workbooks, and collections of workbooks, with other OML users.

title: Create Docker registry in OCI
description: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Registry makes it easy for you as a developer to store, share, and manage development artifacts like Docker images. In this lab, you will create compute instance, install Docker and push images to registry.

title: Querying Data in the Autonomous Database
description: Oracle Autonomous Database can use Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Object Store as the location of external tables. In this workshop, you will load data into an Autonomous Database instance using SQL Web Developer, upload files into an Object Store, and use the files as the source of external tables.

title: OCI Configuring Auto Scaling
description: In this lab we will create compute instance, instance configuration and then configure auto scaling.

title: Get Started with Oracle Data Safe Fundamentals
description: This workshop lets you practice the main features in Oracle Data Safe, including Activity Auditing, Alerts, Security Assessment, User Assessment, Data Discovery, and Data Masking.

title: Oracle Fleet Patching and Provisioning (FPP) - Quick Start
description: This is an online guide to help jump start and cover the basic operations for a novice user of Oracle Fleet Patching and Provisioning (FPP). In this series of How-Tos we will show the basic elements needed to become acquainted with FPP.

title: OCI Configuring Dynamic CPU Scaling in Autonomous Transaction Processing Service
description: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure's Autonomous Transaction Processing Cloud Service is a fully managed, preconfigured database environment. You do not need to configure or manage any hardware, or install any software. After provisioning, you can scale the number of CPU cores or the storage capacity of the database at any time without impacting availability or performance.

title: Multitenant Advanced Capabilities
description: Learn many of the advanced Multitenant capabilities including Application Containers, Lockdown Profiles, Advanced Networking and Isolation.

title: Hitchhiker's Guide for Upgrading to Oracle Database 19c
description: Upgrade your Database to 19c NOW! Using Mike Dietrich's popular workshop.

title: Scaling and Performance in the Autonomous Database
description: In this workshop, you will provision a new ADW instance and connect to the database using Oracle SQL Developer Web, then scale up your Oracle Autonomous Data Warehouse (ADW) or Autonomous Transaction Processing (ATP) service to have more CPUs. You will also watch a demo that shows the performance and concurrency impacts of scaling your service online.

title: Oracle Database Hybrid Active Data Guard
description: Oracle’s Maximum Availability Architecture (Oracle MAA) is the best practices blueprint for data protection and availability for Oracle databases deployed on private, public or hybrid clouds. Data Guard and Active Data Guard provide disaster recovery for databases with recovery time objectives (RTO) that cannot be met by restoring from backup.In this lab, You will learn how to setup hybrid data guard from on-premise to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. You will use a compute instance in the OCI to simulate the on-premise primary database, and provision a database system on OCI to act as the standby database in the cloud.

title: Creating a Resource Manager Stack
description: The Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Resource Manager is a fully managed service that lets you provision infrastructure resources on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure using Terraform. You can bring in your Terraform template definition and easily create and manage your infrastructure resources. This allows you to use infrastructure-as-code to automate provisioning across all OCI resources including Compute, Networking, Load Balancers, Block and Object Storage. Resource Manager also integrates with Identity and Access Management (IAM) so you can define granular permissions for Terraform operations. It currently has support for CLI, SDK and Console.

title: Enterprise Data Quality
description: Enterprise Data Quality brings the necessary functionality for delivering Data Fit for Use and that satisfy an organization’s current and emerging Data Governance requirements for your Data Warehouse / Data Mart / Data Lake initiatives. EDQ offers an integrated suite of data quality tools that provide an end-to-end solution to measure, improve and manage the quality of data from any domain. EDQ also combines powerful data profiling, cleansing, matching and monitoring capabilities while offering unparalleled ease of use. Features of EDQ include:    Advanced data profiling to identify and measure poor quality data and identify rule requirements to resolve your Project and/or Enterprise data quality issues    Semantic and pattern-based recognition to accurately parse and standardize data that is poorly structured    An innovative Open Reference Data Architecture enabling easy creation, customization and maintenance of business rules that adapt and learn from your data to enable and expedite automated solutions to jumpstart, continually improve and socialize your data quality over time    Easy integration with ODI scenarios

title: Get started with Converged Database for Developers - On Premises
description: In this workshop, you will gain first-hand experience of using data types beyond relational data - JSON, XML, Spatial and Graph.  As opposed to using multiple single purpose databases for each data type, using a converged database results in a unified data tier, enabling real-time analytics and machine learning on production data.

title: OCI Auditing in an Autonomous Database
description: Auditing is the monitoring and recording of configured database actions, from both database users and non-database users. You can base auditing on individual actions, such as the type of SQL statement executed, or on combinations of data that can include the user name, application, time, and so on. In this workshop you will create an audit policy and query UNIFIED_AUDIT_TRAIL to view the generated audit records.

title: Building an App using REST Data Sources for Oracle Autonomous Cloud Services
description: This lab REST enables database objects, and then uses those REST endpoints as the basis for Web Source Modules within an application. Application components are then defined against these Web Source Modules, instead of being defined on local database objects.

title: Oracle Data Integrator
description: Oracle Data Integrator is a comprehensive data integration platform that covers all data integration requirements: from high-volume, high-performance batch loads, to event-driven, trickle-feed integration processes, to SOA-enabled data services. In this workshop you will explore ODI using detailed examples to help you learn how to use Oracle Data Integrator to solve business problems.

title: Configure Virtual Cloud Network Peering
description: Local VCN peering is the process of connecting two VCNs in the same region and tenancy so that their resources can communicate using private IP addresses without routing the traffic over the internet or through your on-premises network. Without peering, a given VCN would need an internet gateway and public IP addresses for the instances that need to communicate with another VCN.

title: Configuring Oracle Functions
description: In this workshop you will walk-through Oracle Functions, a fully managed, highly scalable, on-demand, Functions-as-a-Service platform, built on enterprise-grade Oracle Cloud Infrastructure and powered by the Fn Project open source engine. Use Oracle Functions (sometimes abbreviated to just Functions) when you want to focus on writing code to meet business needs.

title: OCI Identity and Access Management
description: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Identity and Access Management (IAM) Service lets you control who has access to your cloud resources. You control the types of access a group of users has and to which specific resources. The purpose of this workshop to give you an overview of the IAM Service components and an example scenario to help you understand how they work together.

title: Protect Your Data with Oracle Active Data Guard
description: This workshop focuses on Creating Active Data Guard 19c in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure using the Oracle Cloud. Explore fundamentals of Active Data Guard on 19c.  Perform switchover, failover, DML Redirection and more!

title: Creating an App based on Existing Tables for Oracle Autonomous Cloud Service (20.1)
description: In this workshop, you will create an APEX development environment, then work with sample tables to create an application in minutes. You will improve the application by adding pages, linking pages, manipulating regions and items to improve the usability of your application, without creating any code!

title: Building an App using a Remote Data Source for Oracle Autonomous Cloud Services
description: This lab utilizes Quick SQL to build a table in your local database. Then you will load the new table with data from a REST API call to a comma delimited file (.csv). Now you have the table with lots of great data, it is time to build an APEX application on top of it and then improve the application with an updated report, and a user driven chart.The data used is the Big Mac Index from the Economist, which uses the price of McDonald’s Big Mac as the benchmark to measure the purchasing power parity between currencies.

title: Building an App from a Spreadsheet using Oracle APEX
description: In this workshop, you create a fully featured, responsive Web app using Oracle APEX on Oracle Cloud. This workshop gets you a well-rounded understanding of low code app development with APEX. You will be amazed at how you went from a spreadsheet to a beautiful, and fully functional Web app to explore NYC High Schools in minutes!This workshop walks you through uploading the NYC High Schools spreadsheet data into an Oracle database table, and then creating an application based on this new table. You will then play with the Faceted Search, Interactive Report, and improve the attached form. You will learn how to add a map region to the search page in order to visually enhance the page. You will also learn to download and use the application as a Progressive Web App (PWA).

title: Visualizing Your Data on Autonomous Database
description: In this workshop, you will load a sample data set, then install Oracle Analytics Desktop to perform visualizations on the data in Autonomous Database.

title: Building a Proof-of-Concept for Oracle Autonomous Cloud Services (20.1)
description: This lab starts with a napkin design of data structures we wouldlike to use for a proof-of-concept. Using Quick SQL you will quicklydefine the data structures and utilize various table and columndirectives to better define the tables and also create somedummy data. You will then be creating an application based onthe new tables. Lastly, you will be updating some of the generatedcomponents to improve the initial app.

title: Low Code Development with Oracle Autonomous Database
description: This lab starts with a napkin design of data structures we would like to use for a proof-of-concept. Using Quick SQL you will quickly define the data structures and utilize various table and column directives to better define the tables and also create some dummy data. You will then be creating an application based on the new tables. Lastly, you will be updating some of the generated components to improve the initial app.

title: Database 19c - Python
description: In this workshop, you will  write Python code to connect to an query data from an Oracle Database, including JSON data.

title: Database 19c New Features For Developers
description: Explore the new features available to developers in Oracle Database 19c.  Implement and evaluate features like JSON Documents, Python, Automatic Indexing, Hybrid Partitioning and more.

title: Simplify Microservices with Converged Oracle Database
description: Modern App developers build data-centric microservices across all industries for sales, operations, support, logistics, customer service, etc. workflows.  Explore the data and application services inside and outside the converged Oracle Database - multi-tenant for SaaS Apps; using variety of data types (Documents, Tables, Key-value, Spatial, etc.), programming in multiple languages, using built-in Event Mesh (Oracle AQ/TEQ) - by building a sample food delivery application ‘GrabDish’ (like UberEats).

title: Database 19c - JSON
description: Oracle Database supports JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) data natively with relational database features, including transactions, indexing, declarative querying, and views.   Learn how to store, manage and query json data

title: NoSQL Cloud Service
description: The Oracle NoSQL Database provides extreme availability and exceptionally predictable, single-digit millisecond response times to simple queries at scale. Oracle NoSQL Database Cloud Service is a fully managed database cloud service that handles large amounts of data at high velocity. In this workshop, you will get started with tables in Oracle NoSQL Database Cloud Service and create an API signing key for an Oracle Cloud user account and a configuration file required to connect a client to Oracle Cloud. You will build a sample HelloWorld application to connect to an Oracle NoSQL Database Cloud Service and perform basic table-level operations.

title: Get Started with Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Core Services
description: The labs in this workshop cover an introduction to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Core Services, including virtual cloud networks (VCN), compute and storage services. These labs also provide some of the foundational skills and knowledge you'll need to attempt the [Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Foundations Certification](https://www.oracle.com/cloud/iaas/training/foundations.html) offered by Oracle University.The Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Foundations Certification provides candidates with foundational knowledge of core cloud computing concepts and an understanding of those services in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. The certification is intended for candidates with technical and non-technical backgrounds who want to validate their understanding of Oracle Cloud infrastructure.The labs featured on this page cover various solutions, skill levels, and categories based on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI).

title: Deploy an OKE Cluster Using Oracle Cloud Shell
description: Oracle Kubernetes Engine (OKE) is a managed container orchestration service to deploy and manage containerized applications. It is based on the open source Kubernetes system and is available on the Oracle public cloud. The Kubernetes master nodes are managed by Oracle and the agent nodes are managed by the users. As it is a managed service, OKE is free, you only need to pay for agent nodes. OKE can be created in the Oracle console, with the OCI CLI, using Terraform.This lab will provide a step by step guide to deploy an OKE cluster, connect to it and run a sample application all using oci cli.

title: OCI Command CLI Playground
description: This lab will walk you through installation and configuration of the CLI, along with the execution of several create, read, and terminate commands. Upon completion of this lab you should have a good understanding of how to use the OCI CLI to automate common tasks in OCI.

title: Deploy HA Applications Using Load Balancers
description: The Load Balancing Service provides automated traffic distribution from one entry point to multiple servers within your Virtual Cloud Network (VCN). The service offers a public load balancer with a public IP address, provisioned bandwidth, and high availability. Deploy web servers on two compute instances in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI), configured in High Availability mode by using a Load Balancer.

title: Creating Compute Instance using Custom Image
description: Explore the Custom image feature of OCI. Using this feature an existing Compute instance with software packages and updates installed can be used to created additional compute instances. These new compute instances will come with all the software packages and updates pre-installed.

title: Using Events and Notification
description: The Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Notifications service broadcasts messages to distributed components through a publish-subscribe pattern, delivering secure, highly reliable, low latency and durable messages for applications hosted on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure and externally. The Notifications service enables you to set up communication channels for publishing messages using topics and subscriptions . When a message is published to a topic, the Notifications service sends the message to all of the topic's subscriptions. In this workshop we will verify notifications when a compute instance is launched and deleted.

title: Configuring NAT Gateway for Private Compute Instance
description: Many Oracle Cloud Infrastructure customers have compute instances in virtual cloud networks (VCNs) that, for privacy, security, or operational concerns, are connected to private subnets. To grant these resources access to the public internet for software updates, CRL checks, and so on, a customer’s only option has been to create a NAT instance in a public subnet and route traffic through that instance by using its private IP address as a route target from within the private subnet. Although many have successfully used this approach, it does not scale easily and provides a myriad of administrative and operational challenges.

title: Create an Object Storage Service
description: In this workshop, you will use the Object Service and an example scenario to help you understand how the service works.  You will create an Object storage bucket, upload and object and create a pre-authenticated request link.

title: EM  - Hybrid Multitenant Database Lifecycle Management
description: In this hands-on lab learn how to automate and scale lifecycle management of Oracle Multitenant Databases across your hybrid enterprise. The lab begins by addressing a development request for a Pluggable Database (PDB) for testing purposes and then performing daily database lifecycle operations like creating clones and unplugging. Gain an understanding of how you can quickly provision, resize and even delete PDBs using Oracle Enterprise Manager Self-Service capabilities.

title: Using Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Block Volumes
description: Create a compute instance, install httpd server on it, attach block volume to it, and install an app on the Block Volume. You will then create a second compute instance using the boot volume of the first compute instance and move the Block Volume to the second compute instance (with the app installed).

title: OCI Configuring File System Storage
description: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure File Storage Service provides a durable, scalable, distributed, enterprise-grade network file system. You can connect to a File Storage Service file system from any bare metal, virtual machine, or container instance in your Virtual Cloud Network (VCN). You can also access a file system from outside the VCN using Oracle Cloud Infrastructure FastConnect and Internet Protocol security (IPSec) virtual private network (VPN).

title: Hybrid Database Configuration and Compliance Management
description: In this workshop learn how to check, verify, and secure your database configurations and how to automate them to be compliant with industry and regulatory standards like CIS and STIG. Understand how to control configuration drift by monitoring it against a baseline to ensure each database is secure. Understand how to get an inventory of all managed database targets including different versions and the number of instances deployed over a period of time using Oracle Enterprise Manager.

title: EM  - Database Performance Management: Find, Fix, Validate
description: Learn how to use Oracle Enterprise Manager to locate database performance issues, fix them, and validate it worked. Understand how capture and running your workload, usePerformance Hub, perform real-time database operation monitoring. Tune SQL in a PDB. review SQL Performance Analyzer Optimizer Statistics and operate Database Workload Replay.

title: EM - Automated Database Patching at Scale with Fleet Maintenance
description: Database Fleet Maintenance is an end-to-end automated solution for patching and upgrade of Oracle Database. Fleet Maintenance enables DBAs to automate patching of wide range of DB Configurations including Oracle RAC environments with Data Guard Standby.Benefits with Fleet Maintenance:• Minimum Downtime with Out of Place patching• Enterprise Scale with Enterprise Manger Deployment Procedures Framework• Single pane of glass for monitoring and managing entire patching and upgrade operations• Ability to schedule/retry/suspend/resume.• Database patching across different infrastructure including engineered systems like Exadata

title: EM - Automated Database Upgrade at Scale with Fleet Maintenance
description: Database Fleet Maintenance is an end-to-end automated solution for patching and upgrade of Oracle Database. Fleet Maintenance enables DBAs to automate patching of wide range of DB Configurations including Oracle RAC environments with Data Guard Standby.Benefits with Fleet Maintenance:• Minimum Downtime with Out of Place patching• Enterprise Scale with Enterprise Manger Deployment Procedures Framework• Single pane of glass for monitoring and managing entire patching and upgrade operations• Ability to schedule/retry/suspend/resume.• Database patching across different infrastructure including engineered systems like Exadata

title: Deploying Infrastructure using Terraform
description: Terraform is Infrastructure as Code tool for building and managing infrastructure efficiently and elegantly. In this lab we will use pre-configured terraform scripts to deploy VCN, Compute Instance, Block storage and attach the block storage to compute instance without using OCI console. We will then delete all these infrastructure resources.

title: Deploying OCI Streaming Service
description: The workshop aims to create a public stream pool and streams using the pre-authenticated OCI CLI on the OCI console. Post creation we publish messages to streams and consume them using cursors and groups.

title: Using OCI Audit Service
description: OCI Audit service automatically records calls to all supported OCI public application programming interface (API) endpoints as log events. This workshop  provides an overview of the Audit Service and an example scenario to help you understand how the service works.

title: Modernize and Extend Legacy Apps in the Oracle Cloud
description: This workshop will walk you through the process of converting a legacy java application into a micro-service based application leveraging Terraform, Autonomous Transaction Processing, Developer Cloud Service, CI/CD, Oracle Kubernetes Engine, Oracle Container Information Registry, Visual Builder Studio, APEX and the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. To highlight the reality of the solution, we are going to ask you all to become temporary employees of a fictitious organization. You will then follow the journey of five members of an IT staff including an Operations Engineer, a DBA, a Devops Engineer, a Java Developer and a Java Script Developer. Each member of the team has different roles, different problems and different talents and will come together with the organizations CTO to unite and transform a legacy monolithic application into a Cloud Native, next generation micro-service based application.

title: Building Java Cloud Applications with Micronaut and OCI
description: Oracle provides an open, modern, easy, and intelligent platform and infrastructure for developers to build and innovate. Micronaut is an innovative new framework that precomputes your framework infrastructure at compilation time. This workshop will take you through combining Micronaut and Oracle Cloud with Autonomous Database to build an efficient and lean Microservice application.

title: Budget and Cost Analysis
description: Cost Analysis is an easy-to-use visualization tool to help you track and optimize your Oracle Cloud Infrastructure spending, allows you to generate charts, and download accurate, reliable tabular reports of aggregated cost data on your Oracle Cloud Infrastructure consumption.  In this workshop you will use the tool for spot checks of spending trends and for generating reports.

title: Oracle GoldenGate Stream Analytics
description: Stream Analytics is an in-memory technology for real-time analytic computations on streaming data. This workshop includes several labs that will walk you through navigation and exploration of GoldenGate Stream Analytics (GGSA) using a sample IoT scenario. It will then allow the user to create a new pipeline given a Retail use case.

title: Develop Apps using JSON, XML, Spatial and Graph
description: In this workshop, you will gain first-hand experience of using data types beyond relational data - JSON, XML, Spatial and Graph. As opposed to using multiple single purpose databases for each data type, using a converged database results in a unified data tier, enabling real-time analytics and machine learning on production data.

title: Lift and Shift On-Premises EBS to OCI
description: Explore the process of deploying the EBS Cloud Manager, which you can use to create EBS environments in OCI. This process uses the Marketplace EBS Cloud Manager Stack. In this workshop, you will connect to an OCI tenancy and create a user, group, and an application through IAM identity domains. Then, create an EBS Cloud Manager instance and associate networking components using the Marketplace stacks on OCI. Finally, from the Cloud Manager created you will automate the creation of an EBS environment and then clone it.

title: Getting started with OCI Data Science
description: The Oracle Data Science Service is a fully managed, self-service platform for data science teams to build, train, and manage machine learning (ML) models in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. This lab will introduce the Accelerated Data Science SDK, showing you how it can speed up your workflow and make you more productive. In this module, we will build a binary classification model in an effort to predict employee attrition. Using the Accelerated Data Science (ADS) SDK we will do an exploratory data analysis (EDA) to understand the nature and distribution of the data. We will visualize the data and assess the correlation between predictors. The Oracle AutoML tools will be used to perform and automatically tune Light Gradient Boosting Machine (GBM), XG Boost, Random Forest and Logistic Regression classifiers. These models will be evaluated and compared using ADS' model evaluation tools. Once the best model is selected, we will use the machine learning explainability (MLX) tools to explain the global and local behavior of the model. That is, we will see what features are important in the model using feature permutation importance, partial dependence plots (PDP), individual conditional expectation (ICE) and several other methods used to determine why the model made the prediction that it did.

title: Setup and Manage an Oracle Big Data Service(BDS) HA cluster using Oracle Distribution of Hadoop(ODH)
description: The labs in this workshop walk you through all the steps to get started using Oracle Big Data Service (BDS). You will learn how to plan, create, monitor, and access a High Availability (HA) Hadoop cluster using BDS and Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI). You will also add Oracle SQL Cloud to the cluster and access the utility and master node in the cluster using public IP addresses. You will learn how to use Ambari and Hue to access the cluster directly in a web browser. Finally, you will create a Hadoop Administrator user that that will have full access to all the data and metadata on the cluster.

title: DB Security - Label Security
description: In this lab you will learn to use Oracle Label Security (OLS) to protect data at the data-row level. Label Security lets you assign arbitrary data classification labels to rows of data, and also assign access to data labels to database users. Labels may be hierarchical, group inclusive, or compartment exclusive (or combinations of the three). Label Security can be used to help you meet compliance requirements like tracking and enforcing access to data, or restriction of processing, based on data subject requirements. You'll work with a few simple test applications to learn techniques for integrating Label Security with data-driven applications.This lab is included in the DB Security Advanced lab. If you have completed that lab, then there is no need to do this one.

title: Departmental Data Warehouse - HR Analytics
description: Lines of business like the Human Resources department, typically, don't have timely or efficient access to data and information. Analysts gather the data manually, work with it on an individual basis, and then share copies of files through email or file servers. With Oracle Autonomous Data Warehouse and Oracle Analytics Cloud, you can load and optimize data from a multitude of sources into a centralized data warehouse for analysis so departments can gain actionable insights. This solution uses data in an Oracle Autonomous Data Warehouse and then uses Oracle Analytics Cloud to analyze the data to provide actionable insights.

title: Analytics for LOB - Internal
description: Use Oracle Fusion ERP Analytics to enhance business insights through both pre-built dashboards and self-service analytics. Use Oracle Essbase to help model business performance levels and deliver what-if analyses for varying conditions.

title: Provision HPC Cluster from Oracle Marketplace Image
description: High Performance Computing is changing product development and research enabling customers to solve complex problems faster. This means fewer prototypes, accelerates testing, and decreases time to market. Oracle offers on-demand HPC infrastructure, suitable for any HPC workload, based on the most advanced compute, storage, networking, and software technologies. You get all this at a fraction of the cost of building it yourself and avoid capacity utilization issues.Oracle provides the most elastic and scalable cloud infrastructure to run your HPC applications. With virtually unlimited capacity, engineers, researchers, and HPC system owners can innovate beyond the limitations of on-premises HPC infrastructure. Oracle delivers an integrated suite of services that provides everything needed to quickly and easily build and manage HPC clusters in the cloud to run the most compute intensive workloads across various industry verticals. These workloads span the traditional HPC applications, like genomics, computational chemistry, financial risk modeling, computer aided engineering, seismic imaging, and weather prediction, as well as emerging applications, like machine learning, deep learning, and autonomous driving.

title: DB Security - Database Vault
description: In this lab you will use Database Vault to implement advanced data access controls - including separation of duties, privileged user access controls, and enforcing a trusted path to data. Database Vault is one of the most important security solutions you can apply to block the most common database attacks, including compromised user credentials and privilege escalation. This lab is included in the DB Security Advanced lab. If you have completed that lab, then there is no need to do this one.

title: Migrate WebLogic Server to OCI
description: This workshop will guide you through migrating a WebLogic Server domain from a pre-packaged 'on-premises' demo environment to OCI with the WebLogic Server stack from the Marketplace. The demo environment provides a simple set of applications: a static web app and a database-connected app to showcase the migration of a realistic environment. It makes use of the various tool to migrate the WebLogic domain, like WebLogic Deploy Tooling, as well as database migration tools (data pump).

title: Explore how quickly you can analyze your business data in Oracle Cloud
description: In this hands-on lab, you will get first-hand experience of using Oracle Cloud, Oracle Autonomous Database (ADB) and Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC).  For the purpose of this lab, we will use ADW so all the steps will be related to this database service.Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC) is a scalable and secure public cloud service that provides a full set of capabilities to explore and perform collaborative analytics for you, your workgroup, and your enterprise.With Oracle Analytics Cloud, you also get flexible service management capabilities, including fast setup, easy scaling and patching, and automated lifecycle management.

title: Extend your application with advanced chat-bots
description: This workshop walks you through the steps to use Autonomous Database and Application Express (APEX) to store information, offer a REST API with Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS) and enable you to interact with your customers by keeping a conversation with Digital Assistant.Store information in a easy and powerful database and provide a 24/7 conversational experience with people using your services.Explore Oracle Digital Assistant.Explore modern and quick APEX development and build secure and powerful REST APIs.

title: Analyze, Query and Visualize Graphs in Oracle Database
description: This workshop introduces graph features of the Oracle Autonomous Database. It shows how integrating multiple datasets, using a graph, facilitates additional analytics that can lead to new insights. We will use three small datasets for illustrative purposes. The first contains accounts and account owners. The second is purchases by the people who own those accounts. The third is transactions between these accounts.

title: Application integration with SOA
description: Taking a pragmatic approach to modernize application and orchestration integration flow for digital experience. Oracle SOA is standards-based software suite to build, deploy and manage application integration and flow orchestration following the concepts of service-oriented architecture. The components of the suite benefit from consistent tooling, a single deployment and management model, end-to-end security and unified metadata management.

title: Siemens Simcenter STAR-CCM+ in Oracle Cloud
description: Simcenter STAR-CCM+ is a complete multiphysics solution for the simulation of products and designs. This Runbook will take you through the process of deploying a Simcenter STAR-CCM+ cluster on Oracle Cloud with low latency networking between the compute nodes. Running Simcenter STAR-CCM+ on Oracle Cloud is quite straightforward, follow along this guide for all the tips and tricks.The guide is designed to walk you through each step that goes in deploying Simcenter STAR CCM+ on OCI, from launching Cluster Network, to accessing and configuring your cluster and to finally installing STAR CCM+ on OCI. This solutions guide will cover two different methods of launching an HPC Cluster Network, via Marketplace and manually.Depending on your OS, you will want to go with a specific method.

title: Using OCI to Build a Java Application
description: The goal of this workshop is to allow you to discover, on Oracle Cloud, some key features recently added to the Java platform. To achieve this, you will use Java SE 15 which has been released a few hours ago, Helidon, a collection of Java libraries for writing microservices, and the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI).

title: Deploying InnoDB Cluster on OCI using Terraform
description: MySQL InnoDB Cluster provides a complete, high-availability solution for MySQL. MySQL Shell includes AdminAPI, which enables you to easily configure and administer a group of at least three MySQL server instances to function as an InnoDB cluster. Each MySQL server instance runs MySQL Group Replication, which provides the mechanism to replicate data within InnoDB clusters, with built-in failover.

title: Migrate Tomcat Java applications to OCI
description: Learn how to migrate Java applications backed by an Oracle database running on Tomcat to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, using infrastructure-as-code to deploy a Tomcat cluster and an Autonomous Database

title: GROMACS Deployment through Resource Manager
description: GROMACS is a versatile software package to perform molecular dynamics, and is used to simulate different equations with hundreds to millions of particles.This Runbook will take you through the process of deploying GROMACS Software on Oracle Cloud. In this particular demo, we are going to achieve this using our Resource Manager, available on our OCI Console. Running GROMACS on Oracle Cloud is quite straightforward, follow along this guide for all the tips and tricks.

title: Oracle Identity Cloud Service Fundamentals
description: Identity Cloud Service is Oracle’s next generation comprehensive security and identity platform that provides an innovative, fully integrated service that delivers all the core identity and access management capabilities through a Cloud platform “as a service”. The design of Identity Cloud Service (IDCS) is based on micro service architecture which is naturally aligned with Cloud principles of Scalability, Elasticity, Resilience, Ease of Deployment, Functional Agility, Technical Adoption and Organization Alignment.This workshop aims to give you hands-on experience on basic concepts such as user management, SSO, identity providers, multi-factor authentication or adaptive security.

title: Oracle RAC: HA and Scalability for Your Applications
description: Set up a Database System and 2 node RAC in the Oracle Cloud.  Explore Clusterware, FAN (Fast Application Notification), services, parallel execution and more!

title: Migrate SOA Applications to OCI
description: This workshop walks you through the migration of SOA applications from a pre-packaged demo SOA environment to SOA on OCI deployed using the Marketplace.

title: DB Security Basics
description: This workshop is the FIRST INSTALLMENT of the hands-on labs dedicated to Oracle Database Security. Based on an OCI architecture that's deployed in just a few minutes with a simple internet connection, this workshop allows you to test common database security use cases in a complete environment that's already pre-configured by the Oracle Database Security Product Management team. In this workshop, you will explore how to configure the database security baseline, a critical initial step on the path to the Maximum Security Architecture (MSA). You will work with the Database Security Assessment Tool (DBSAT), native network encryption, privilege analysis, unified auditing, and transparent sensitive data protection. This lab also includes Oracle Data Safe, which helps you secure Oracle databases in the cloud and on-premises

title: DB Security - Database  Security Assessment Tool
description: In this workshop you will use the Database Security Assessment Tool (DBSAT) to find areas of risk in your database and determine appropriate strategies to mitigate that risk. DBSAT helps identify sensitive data and analyzes database configurations, users, their entitlements and security policies to uncover security risks and improve the security posture of Oracle Databases. You can use DBSAT to implement and enforce security best practices in your organization and accelerate compliance with regulations such as the EU GDPR. DBSAT is included with the Oracle Database, both Enterprise and Standard editions, and may be downloaded from MyOracleSupport by customers with a valid support agreement.This lab is included in the DB Security Basics lab. If you have completed that lab, then there is no need to do this one.

title: DB Security - Native Network Encryption
description: In this lab you will use to learn Oracle Native Network Encryption (one of two network encryption types supported by the Oracle Database) to encrypt data in motion between the database and Oracle clients or applications. Native Network encryption is the easiest form of network encryption to configure, requiring only a single parameter in the server's configuration files and (in most cases) no client changes. Network encryption can block network sniffing attacks, common during the early reconnaissance phases of most breaches. Native Network Encryption is an included feature of the Oracle Database, both Enterprise and Standard editions.This lab is included in the DB Security Basics lab. If you have completed that lab, then there is no need to do this one.

title: DB Security - Privilege Analysis
description: In this lab you will learn to use Privilege Analysis, a new feature introduced in Oracle Database 12c, to identify unused and potentially excess privileges assigned to database user accounts. Most database breaches involve the use of compromised user accounts - that means that every time you remove an unnecessary privilege from an account you shrink the attack surface area and minimize the blast radius in the event of a successful compromise. Privilege Analysis gives you an alternative to traditional privilege attestation where you just print a list of users and their roles/privileges for review. With Privilege Analysis, you can enrich those reports with  information on privileges that are assigned, but not being used over a period of time. Privilege Analysis is an included feature of Oracle Database Enterprise Edition.This lab is included in the DB Security Basics lab. If you have completed that lab, then there is no need to do this one.

title: DB Security - Unified Auditing
description: In this lab you will learn to use Unified Auditing to capture database activity while minimizing the impact on storage and performance. Auditing is an important detective control that can help you spot malicious activity early, possibly giving you time to block an attack or reducing the time an attacker has to exfiltrate data. Unified Auditing is included with Oracle Database, both Enterprise and Standard editions.This lab is included in the DB Security Basics lab. If you have completed that lab, then there is no need to do this one.

title: DB Security - ASO ( Transparent Data Encryption & Data Redaction )
description: In this lab you will learn about two of the main features of Oracle Advanced Security- Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) and Data Redaction. Advanced Security is one of the most commonly deployed database security options because encrypting data at rest is a critical element of most security standards. After completing this lab, you should continue your investigation of database security with the Oracle Key Vault lab.This lab is included in the DB Security Advanced lab. If you have completed that lab, then there is no need to do this one.

title: DB Security - Data Masking and Subsetting
description: In this workshop you will learn to remove security risk from test and development databases with data masking. You'll start by modeling the schema(s) to be masked, identifying sensitive data, and then move on to creating masking formats that describe how the sensitive data will be masked to remove security risk while still providing a data set that is usable for test and development purposes.This lab is included in the DB Security Advanced lab. If you have completed that lab, then there is no need to do this one.

title: NAMD - Scalable Molecular Dynamics
description: This workshop provides the steps to deploy a GPU machine on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, install NAMD, and run a model using NAMD software.NAMD is a molecular dynamics software that simulates the movements of atoms in biomolecules under a predefined set of conditions. It is used to identify the behavior of these biomolecules when exposed to changes in temperature, pressure and other inputs that mimic the actual conditions encountered in a living organism. NAMD can be used to establish patterns in protein folding, protein-ligand binding, and cell membrane transport, making it a very useful application for drug research and discovery.NAMD is built on Charm++ and Converse, and can run on high performance computers to execute parallel processing. It was developed by the University of Illinois.

title: Artificial Intelligence:  Getting Started with Computer Vision using PyTorch
description: Implementing image classification training is the "Hello World" of computer vision. Although there are many blog posts about the topic, most of them present the solution without adequately explaining the library API, the underlying principals, or both. The "Training a Classifier" guide from PyTorch is a great place to start, but some of the details of the code are explained too sparsely for a reader new to the field. This workshop builds on that tutorial as a base with line-by-line explanations of the code to facilitate a clearer learning pathway. This guide will show you how to train a model using CPUs-only and then explain how to update code to utilize GPU resources.

title: Build the Perfect Digital Assistant for Your Business
description: In this two-hour lab, you'll learn how to work with skills and digital assistants in Oracle Digital Assistant.

title: The Essentials of Cloud Observability
description: In this workshop we go over all the necessary steps to use the OCI logging service & Log Search Console Viewer to ingest, manage and analyze the logs generated by the Cloud Infrastructure.The Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Logging service is a highly scalable and fully managed single pane of glass for all the logs in your tenancy. Logging provides access to logs from Oracle Cloud Infrastructure resources. These logs include critical diagnostic information that describes how resources are performing and being accessed.Estimated Lab Time: 35 minutes

title: Introduction to Cloud Native
description: Get hands-on experience moving an existing application into a containerized CI/CD pipeline and deploying it to a managed Kubernetes service in the Oracle Cloud. During this hands-on lab, learn how to- Containerize microservices using a container native platform- Create and deploy containers to a cluster in the Oracle Container Engine for Kubernetes- Automate complex continuous integration or continuous delivery pipelines- View the container in the OCI registry - Make changes to your containers using Kubernetes

title: Develop and Deploy Modern Application in NodeJS on MySQL
description: It’s time to put things in practice. In this hands-on-session we’ll take the MySQL Database Service in practice and build a cloud-native application using Node.js. Even when you are using a different language, this will provide useful practical experience for building server-less or micro-service architectures using MySQL.

title: DB Security - Audit Vault and DB Firewall
description: In this workshop you will work with Audit Vault and Database Firewall (AVDF), Oracle's Database Activity Monitoring solution. AVDF lets you collect activity information from various databases including Oracle, MySQL, SQL Server, Db2, Sybase, PostgreSQL, and MongoDB - in fact, just about anything that produces an audit trail. For the most common RDBMS platforms, activity information can be gathered via native database audit, network data capture, or a combination of the two. As the "firewall" in the product name implies, AVDF can also be used to block out-of-policy activity from ever reaching the database.This lab is included in the DB Security Advanced lab. If you have completed that lab, then there is no need to do this one.

title: Getting started with Oracle Property Graph on Docker
description: This workshop introduces the property graph features of an Oracle Database. It shows how integrating multiple datasets, using a graph, facilitates additional analytics that can lead to new insights. We will use three small datasets for illustrative purposes. The first contains accounts and account owners. The second is purchases by the people who own those accounts. The third is transactions between these accounts.All components (database and graph server) are deployed and run in Docker containers on the Oracle Cloud instance.

title: Containerized Development with Docker on Oracle Database
description: Explore the basics of Docker containers.  Manage a docker container running the Oracle Database, deploy a container application, explore with Enterprise manager, and make modifications to the application using docker commands.

title: Active/Passive Data Recovery
description: The workshop will leverage rsync to sync application files between the primary and DR servers, set up DR failover using Oracle Data Guard through the OCI console, and simulate DR for solution verification.

title: PeopleSoft Cloud Manager On OCI
description: This hands-on lab guides users through all necessary steps to spin up a PeopleSoft environment in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. We begin by preparing the tenancy with IAM resources (compartment, user, group, and policies). Next, generating keys, provisioning Cloud Manager 15 using Marketplace, and deploying a PeopleSoft environment. Users can then follow Labs 12-18 to familiarize themselves with Cloud Manager features such as cloning, selective adoption and governance policies.

title: LS-Dyna Runbook
description: LS-DYNA is a general-purpose finite element program capable of simulating complex real world problems. It is used by the automobile, aerospace, construction, military, manufacturing, and bioengineering industries. This Runbook will take you through the process of deploying an LS Dyna cluster on Oracle Cloud with low latency networking between the compute nodes. Running LS Dyna on Oracle Cloud is quite straightforward, follow along this guide for all the tips and tricks.

title: Get Started with Oracle Database
description: The labs in this workshop walk you through all the steps to get started using the Oracle Database and perform simple operations on tables. While this workshop applies equally to either on-premises databases or cloud-based databases in an Autonomous Database cloud service, the labs will show how to get started using an Autonomous Database. You will provision a new autonomous database instance in the Oracle Cloud, connect to the database using a SQL Worksheet in Database Actions, perform queries, and create a schema in which you will create a user, assign privileges, create tables, and load and update data.

title: Migrate WebLogic Server to OCI with Autonomous Database
description: Migrate WebLogic Server domain from on-premises to OCI with WebLogic Server stack on the Marketplace, using Autonomous Database as the Application Database. In this workshop, you will migrate a WebLogic domain with its applications and resources to OCI using a simulated on-premises environment. Provision the Weblogic Server on OCI with the Marketplace and the Application Database on OCI Autonomous Database. Then, migrate the database from on-premises using data pump and Weblogic domain applications and resources with Weblogic Deploy Tooling. Finally, scale the WebLogic Domain.

title: Migrate WebLogic to WebLogic on OKE
description: Migrate a WebLogic Server domain from on-premises to WebLogic Server on OKE provisioned with the Marketplace. This workshop will guide you through the end-to-end migration of a WebLogic domain, along with the application database, to WebLogic on OKE. In this workshop, you will migrate a WebLogic domain with its applications and resources to Oracle Kubernetes Engine using a simulated on-premises environment. Provision the Weblogic Server on OKE and CI/CD infrastructure with the Marketplace and the Application Database on OCI Autonomous Database. Then, migrate the database from on-premises using data pump and the Weblogic domain applications and resources with Weblogic Deploy Tooling and Jenkins. Finally, tear down the environment.

title: Launch Your First MySQL Database Service System
description: The MySQL Database Service (MDS) is the only database service that is 100% developed, managed, and supported by the MySQL team. MDS is the same MySQL Enterprise Edition that your know and use, now available in the cloud as a fully-managed service running on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. In this workshop, you will learn how to create and use MySQL Database Service on the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.

title: Disaster Recovery: Pilot Light - App & DB
description: In this workshop, you will enable application & database DR across regions on OCI and automate block volume backups to a new region. Then setup DNS on OCI and simulate disaster and subsequent recovery.

title: Install JDE on OCI
description: This workshop will provide you with the tools necessary to complete the steps required to install the JD Edwards Enterprise Release 23 trial edition on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI). Explore how to run and manage that environment.

title: DB Security Advanced
description: This workshop is the SECOND INSTALLMENT of the hands-on labs dedicated to Oracle Database Security. Based on an OCI architecture that's deployed in just a few minutes with a simple internet connection, this workshop allows you to test common database security use cases in a complete environment that's already pre-configured by the Oracle Database Security Product Management team. In this workshop, you will go beyond the security baseline to mitigate additional security risks and satisfy regulatory requirements. You will work with Advanced Security (including transparent data encryption and data redaction), Database Vault, Label Security, Data Masking and Subsetting, Audit Vault and Database Firewall, and Key Vault. Note that most of these solutions have their own dedicated labs. If you prefer to just work with one component of the Maximum Security Architecture, you can search directly for the dedicated lab that matches your interest. Alternatively, you can skip around in this lab - each of the areas (except for Key Vault) can be done individually without doing the other labs first.

title: DB Security - Key Vault
description: In this lab you will learn about Oracle Key Vault (OKV), including using Key Vault to back up and protect Oracle Wallets, provide online key distribution and security for Transparent Data Encryption (TDE), and securely distribute secrets.  While not mandatory, you will probably find it better to have completed the TDE portion of "DB Security - Advanced Security" prior to attempting this OKV lab.This lab is included in the DB Security Advanced lab. If you have completed that lab, then there is no need to do this one.

title: Migration of Monolith to Cloud Native - Extended
description: This workshop walks you through the steps of refactoring a simple existing monolithic application into multiple microservices using Helidon, Oracles Java-based microservices framework which meets the Eclipse MP standard. The microservices are then packed using docker and deployed into the OCIR OKE is used to deploy the microservices. The lab looks at how to use OKE for increased availability and automatic scaling, as well as automated rollouts. Optional modules include using Prometheus and Grafana for monitoring, Flagger to capture log data and store it in Elastic Search or Oracle Object Storage, and the use of the linked service mesh to provide additional security, monitoring, and canary deployments.

title: Creating Microservices with Helidon MP and packaging using Docker - Extended
description: This workshop walks you through the steps of refactoring a simple existing monolithic application into multiple microservices using Helidon, Oracles Java-based microservices framework which meets the Eclipse MP standard. The microservices are then packed using docker and deployed into the OCIR.Optional modules cover Helidon features to access the request context, update existing non-Helidon code communicate with a separate microservice, and to create self-describing API's using the Helidon OpenAPI feature.

title: Creating Microservices with Helidon MP and  Docker
description: This workshop walks you through the steps of refactoring a simple existing monolithic application into multiple microservices using Helidon, Oracles Java-based microservices framework which meets the Eclipse MP standard. The microservices are then packed using docker and deployed into the OCIR.

title: Deploying microservices in Kubernetes
description: The Oracle Kubernetes Environment is used to deploy microservices. In this lab, you will look at how to use OKE for increased availability and automatic scaling, as well as online rollouts of new software versions.

title: Migration of Monolith to Cloud Native
description: This workshop walks you through the steps of refactoring a simple existing monolithic application into multiple microservices using Helidon, Oracles Java-based microservices framework which meets the Eclipse MP standard. The microservices are then packed using docker and deployed into the OCIR. OKE is used to deploy the microservices, the lab looks at how to use OKE for increased availability and automatic scaling, as well as automated rollouts.

title: Deploying Microservices in Kubernetes and OCI Supporting Features
description: OKE is used to deploy microservices. In this lab, you will look at how to use OKE for increased availability and automatic scaling, as well as online rollouts. Optional modules include using Prometheus and Grafana for monitoring, Fluentd to capture log data and store it in Elastic Search or Oracle Object Storage, and the use of the LinkerD service mesh to provide additional security, monitoring and canary deployments.

title: Using Helidon to Create Microservices from a Monolith - Extended
description: Cloud native deployments using microservices are one of the latest deployment architectures. This lab will show you how to use the Helidon Micro Profile framework to REST enable existing (or new) code and add security, configuration management and handle the new types of fault that come in from distributed processing. You will see how to easily connect to a database, create communicating microservices, and also how you can easily connect to a microservice from existing code, demonstrating how you can split part of a monolith into a microservice. You will explore how microservices support high availability deployments in Kubernetes, and how to trace the flow of a request across multiple microservices. The simple generation of metrics data for monitoring will be shown. Optionally you will see how to access the context of a request and how to create self-describing API's conforming to the OpenAPI standard

title: Using Helidon to Create Microservices from a Monolith
description: Cloud native deployments using microservices are one of the latest deployment architectures. This lab will show you how to use the Helidon Micro Profile framework to REST enable existing (or new) code and add security, configuration management and handle the new types of fault that come in from distributed processing. You will see how to easily connect to a database, create communicating microservices, and also how you can easily connect to a microservice from existing code, demonstrating how you can split part of a monolith into a microservice. You will explore how microservices support high availability deployments in Kubernetes, and how to trace the flow of a request across multiple microservices. The simple generation of metrics data for monitoring will be shown

title: Work with Spatial Data in Oracle Autonomous Database
description: This workshop introduces the spatial features of Oracle Database. You'll learn how to use spatial queries to identify items based on proximity and containment.

title: Database 21c New Features
description: Explore the new features available in the latest release of the Oracle Database.

title: Improve Performance and Functionality of Oracle Big Data Cloud Service and Oracle Autonomous Data Warehouse in Oracle Database 21c
description: Explore the new Big Data and warehousing features available in the latest release of the Oracle Database.

title: Database 21c - Utilities
description: Explore the new Data Pump features available in the latest release of the Oracle Database.

title: Database 21c - Performance & High Availability
description: Explore the performance and HA new features in Database 21c.

title: Get Started with Oracle Database 21c Security
description: Explore the new security features available in the latest release of the Oracle Database.

title: Database 21c - Blockchain
description: This workshop offers hands-on labs that highlight the new enhancements in the latest release of the Oracle Database, 21c centering around the Blockchain tables feature.  Blockchain is also available in Release 19.10 of the Oracle Database.

title: Converged Database with OAS for Developers
description: This workshop brings together the converged database features using Oracle Analytics Server.  Explore  Data Visualization, Augmented Analytics and Predictive Analytics in detail for On-premises platforms

title: Converged Database with Weblogic for Developers
description: This workshop brings together the converged database features using Weblogic. Java Stream Application is deployed in Weblogic Server. 1. Offload Converged Database features for Multiple Datatypes in a single JEE application 2. Show ease of coding for different data types 3. Leverage different built-in functions for JSON, XML, Graph and Spatial Data from Converged DB4. Develop REST end points for database development5. Consume out of box REST options from Converged Database in application

title: Modernize Enterprise Apps using Coherence Cache with Weblogic
description: Modernize Enterprise Apps using Coherence Cache with Weblogic. Create Coherence Cache, allow Cache to be populated by Weblogic and Helidon Apps, show interoperability by sharing of cached data between Enterprise Weblogic App and Helidon Microservices.This workshop uses the image from a existing workshop "Converged Database for Developers". The same image will be provisioned and a subset of the Java labs will be executed by the participants. The required product Components already exist in the Image.

title: Modernize Enterprise Java Apps using Weblogic and Helidon Microservices
description: Deploy Java App to Weblogic and Microservice to Helidon, show interoperability by interactive calls  between Enterprise Weblogic App and Helidon Microservices. This workshop uses the image from a existing workshop "Converged Database for Developers". The same image will be provisioned and a subset of the Java labs will be executed by the participants. The required product Components already exist in the Image.

title: Modernize Enterprise Java Apps
description: Deploy Java App to Weblogic and Microservice to Helidon, show interoperability by interactive calls  between Enterprise Weblogic App and Helidon Microservices. This workshop uses the image from a existing workshop "Converged Database for Developers". The same image will be provisioned and a subset of the Java labs will be executed by the participants. The required product Components already exist in the Image.

title: Artificial Intelligence: Build your Own Object Detection Solution
description: Developing a new artificial intelligence solution for object segmentation requires a workflow in order to take in new data, annotate it, and build a model. This workshop sets up this workflow using open source libraries available and provides a single source for instruction on the end-to-end solution.

title: Migrate EBS to OCI EBS Cloud Manager
description: Explore how to migrate an E-Business Suite Environment to the EBS Cloud Manager on OCI. In this workshop, you will provision a sample source environment on OCI then prepare it for migration. Using the Cloud Backup Module, you will take a backup of the source environment which you can then use to deploy an EBS environment on OCI through the Cloud Manager.

title: Simplify Autonomous Application Development with DRAGON
description: Stacks provide developers with a quick framework for creating applications. Like all good stacks, DRAGON is an acronym for the components of the framework: Data, React, Autonomous Database, GraalVM, ORDs, Node.js. In the workshop, you will get use the framework to create a simple application in under a minute, using Oracle Cloud.

title: ExaCS for Modern Data Warehouse
description: This workshop helps you to understand cloud compatibility with on-premises capabilities and budget your time to handle compatibility issues. With modernizing the data management strategy, this workshop leads you through provisioning and setting up your Exadata Cloud Service. It also gives you an introduction to how you can utilize Oracle Data Safe to monitor your infrastructure, how you can use Oracle Golden Gate to perform real-time migrations, and how you can use Oracle Analytics Cloud to create powerful analytics from the data residing in your Exadata Cloud Service.

title: SecureOracle 8.0 - Oracle Identity and Access Management (IAM) Suite 12c R2
description: SecureOracle is a demonstration platform for the Oracle IAM Suite 12c R2 PS4 (12.2.1.4.0)

title: Get started with Graph Studio on Oracle Autonomous Database
description: This workshop introduces key graph data modeling and analysis concepts and the interactive Graph Studio for working with graphs in an Autonomous Database.Oracle Autonomous Database contains features that enable it to function as a scalable property graph database. They automate the creation of graph models and in-memory graphs from database tables. They include notebooks and developer APIs for executing graph queries using PGQL, a SQL-like graph query language, and nearly 60 built-in graph algorithms, and offer dozens of visualizations including native graph visualization.

title: WRF on OCI
description: This lab aims to serve as a guide for setting up and using Weather Research Forecasting (WRF) software on OCI. This lab will guide you through the setup and configuration of all dependencies for setting up and running WRF 4.1.5 and WPS 4.1 as well as running an experiment with real Global Forecast System (GFS) data.

title: Get Started with Oracle Big Data Service (non-HA)
description: The labs in this workshop walk you through all the steps to get started using Oracle Big Data Service (BDS). You will learn how to plan, create, monitor, and access a non-Highly Available  (non-HA) Hadoop cluster using BDS and Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI). You will also add Oracle SQL Cloud to the cluster and access the utility and master nodes in the cluster using reserved public IP addresses. You will learn how to use Cloudera Manager and Hue to access the cluster directly in a web browser. You will also create a Hadoop Administrator user that that will have full access to all the data and metadata on the cluster. You will access HDFS using the newly created user, and add the new user to Hue. You will learn how to upload data to HDFS and to a new bucket in object storage. You will query the HDFS data using Hue and view the data in object storage. Finally, you will learn how to clean up all of the resources that you created in this workshop.

title: Create a Web Application in Oracle Visual Builder
description: In this workshop, you'll learn how to create a web application with some simple pages, as well as how to set up action chains that are kicked off by Visual Builder events.  You'll also see how to drag and drop components to provide simple CRUD operations for your users.

title: ANSYS Fluent Runbook
description: In this workshop, the Runbook will walk you through the process of deploying an ANSYS Fluent cluster on Oracle Cloud with low latency networking between the compute nodes. Explore running ANSYS Fluent on Oracle Cloud with this guide for all the tips and tricks.

title: Graph Studio: Find Circular Payment Chains using Graph Queries in Autonomous Database
description: Use graph analytics and visualization to detect potentially fraudulent money transfers.This workshop introduces key graph data modeling and analysis concepts and the interactive Graph Studio for working with graphs in an Autonomous Database. It shows you how to use graph queries to find circular payments, i.e. potentially fraudulent transactions. You will be using data containing Account and Transaction information. Then create a graph and finally query it and visualize the results.

title: Time Series Forecasting with fb Prophet
description: The Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Data Science service is a fully managed, self-service platform for data science teams to build, train, and manage machine learning (ML) models in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.  This lab will go through the steps of setting up a project and a JupyterLab notebook session in OCI Data Science.  We will go through the process of building a time series model, a type of machine learning problem encountered in a variety of industries including finance, retail and transportation.   We will explore a time series dataset and construct data visualizations.  We will build and train time series models with different machine learning packages including Statsmodels and Prophet, and we will analyze and  compare the model performance.

title: GPU Accelerated Data Science with Nvidia RAPIDS
description: Participants will walk through a series of notebook session workloads run on graphic processing units (GPUs) using NVIDIA RAPIDS framework and the newest Conda environment feature for notebook sessions. Participants will have hands on experience using cuDF and cuML on the NVIDIA Volta V100 generation of GPUs, all running on OCI. An overview of RAPIDS and its capabilities will be provided, along with a series of use cases comparing the performance and speed of RAPIDS versus a similar task performed on CPUs. Participants gain exposure to the latest Conda environment feature that lets users manage the lifecycle of machine learning compute environments.

title: Oracle Analytics Server
description: This workshop is designed to allow participants to learn about Oracle Analytics Server and gain hands-on experience.  Oracle Analytics Server is a modern, self-service visualization and augmented analytics platform that provides a full range of capabilities including artificial intelligence (AI) that quickly surfaces key insights in your datasets, data enrichment features that automatically recommend new elements for analysis, machine learning (ML) capabilities for both traditional and citizen data scientists, and stunning data visualizations and dashboards.

title: Oracle Data Integrator - Basics
description: Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) is a comprehensive data integration platform that covers all data integration requirements: from high-volume, high-performance batch loads, to event-driven, trickle-feed integration processes, to SOA-enabled data services. Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) 12c, the latest version of Oracle’s strategic Data Integration offering, provides superior developer productivity and improved user experience with a redesigned flow-based declarative user interface and deeper integration with Oracle GoldenGate. ODI12c further builds on its flexible and high-performance architecture with comprehensive big data support and added parallelism when executing data integration processes. It includes interoperability with Oracle Warehouse Builder (OWB) for a quick and simple migration for OWB customers to ODI12c. Additionally, ODI can be monitored from a single solution along with other Oracle technologies and applications through the integration with Oracle Enterprise Manager 12c.

title: Oracle Data Integrator - Advanced
description: Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) is a comprehensive data integration platform that covers all data integration requirements: from high-volume, high-performance batch loads, to event-driven, trickle-feed integration processes, to SOA-enabled data services. Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) 12c, the latest version of Oracle’s strategic Data Integration offering, provides superior developer productivity and improved user experience with a redesigned flow-based declarative user interface and deeper integration with Oracle GoldenGate. ODI12c further builds on its flexible and high-performance architecture with comprehensive big data support and added parallelism when executing data integration processes. It includes interoperability with Oracle Warehouse Builder (OWB) for a quick and simple migration for OWB customers to ODI12c. Additionally, ODI can be monitored from a single solution along with other Oracle technologies and applications through the integration with Oracle Enterprise Manager 12c.

title: Converged Functionality of Oracle Autonomous Database
description: A converged database is a multi-model, multitenant, multi-workload database. It supports the data model and access method each development team wants, without unneeded functionality getting in the way. It provides both the consolidation and isolation these different teams want but don’t want to think about. And it excels in all the workloads (like OLTP, analytics, and IoT) these teams require.  Oracle Database 19c is the world’s first converged database.

title: Running OpenFOAM on an HPC Cluster & a Standard VM on OCI
description: High Performance Computing is changing product development and research enabling customers to solve complex problems faster. This means fewer prototypes, accelerates testing, and decreases time to market. Oracle offers on-demand HPC infrastructure, suitable for any HPC workload, based on the most advanced compute, storage, networking, and software technologies. You get all this at a fraction of the cost of building it yourself and avoid capacity utilization issues.Oracle provides the most elastic and scalable cloud infrastructure to run your HPC applications. With virtually unlimited capacity, engineers, researchers, and HPC system owners can innovate beyond the limitations of on-premises HPC infrastructure.
